purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 十 indicates the sound; 隹 (bird) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
大雁 [ dà yàn ]: wild goose; Classifiers: 只
鸿雁 [ hóng yàn ]: (bird species of China) swan goose (Anser cygnoides)
孤雁 [ gū yàn ]: a lonely wild goose; a solitary wild goose
雁过拔毛 [ yàn guò bá máo ]: lit. to grab feathers from a flying goose; fig. to seize any opportunity; pragmatic
沉鱼落雁 [ chén yú luò yàn ]: lit. fish sink, goose alights (idiom, from Zhuangzi 庄子 ); fig. female beauty captivating even the birds and beasts

heisig_chinese_memo: I've been sent to chase the wild goose! I'm here at the top of the cliff, and I can hear Mr. T and that tricky turkey down there snickering about sending me on a search for the wild goose.
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the man with the little bird (倠) under the cliff (厂) is on a wild goose chase
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: I've been sent to chase the wild goose! I'm here at the top of the cliff, and I can hear Mr. T and that tricky turkey down there snickering about sending me on a search for the wild goose.
humanum_full_description_en:
From "隹", from " people ", " factory " sound, the original meaning is migratory bird. Migratory birds resemble goose in shape, with longer necks and wings, shorter feet and tails, and pale purple-brown feathers. Good at swimming and flying. There is another word for " goose " in ancient Chinese, which means " goose ", see " goose ". The words " Goose " and " Goose " are often used interchangeably in ancient texts. Scholars mostly refer to " Goose " as the swan goose and " Goose " as the home goose. "Said Wen": "Birds. From the fowl to the person, the factory sound. Read like a wild goose." "Poetry‧ Xiaoya‧ Hong Goose": "The swan goose is flying, and its feathers are suppressed." Mao Chuan: "Da Yue Hong, Little said a goose."

" Goose " can mean letters. Ming Wangpi's "A Chronicle of Spring Wushang-Xie Xie": "The Hou Men is like a sea of thoughts hanging in the air, worrying about fish and geese."

" Goose " is also an ancient word for " pseudo ", which means fake. "Han Feizi·Said Linxia": "Qi fought against Lu, slandered Ding, and Lu went with his geese. Qi people said: "Goose." Lu people said: "True also." Really fake, this is a real goose, the descendants of Gabe."

Wild geese are migratory birds and fly back to the south after the autumnal equinox. The term " geese " can refer to autumn, such as "Goose Sky", "Goose Universe", and "Goose Night". Wild geese fly to the north every year after the vernal equinox, and fly back to the south after the autumnal equinox. They are also described as "wild goose", such as "goose household" and "goose people."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of "隹", " people " and " factory ", the original meaning is migratory bird.
humanum_full_description:
從「隹」，從「人」，「厂」聲，本義為候鳥。候鳥形狀略似鵝，頸和翼較長，足和尾較短，羽毛淡紫褐色。善於游泳和飛行。古文中另有「鴈」字，即是「鵝」，參見「鵝」。「鴈」、「雁」兩字常互用於古文，學者多以「雁」為鴻雁，「鴈」為家鵝。《說文》：「鳥也。从隹从人，厂聲。讀若鴈。」《詩‧小雅‧鴻雁》：「鴻雁于飛，肅肅其羽。」毛傳：「大曰鴻，小曰鴈。」

　　「雁」可表示書信。明王錂《春蕪記‧言謝》：「侯門如海思空懸，愁絕魚和雁。」

　　「雁」亦是「贗」的古字，表示假的。《韓非子‧說林下》：「齊伐魯，索讒鼎，魯以其鴈往。齊人曰：『鴈也。』魯人曰：『真也。』」陳奇猷集釋引曾廷枚曰：「真贗，本作真鴈，後人加貝。」

　　雁是候鳥，秋分後飛回南方，因以「雁」可指秋季，如「雁天」、「雁宇」、「雁夜」。大雁每年春分後飛往北方，秋分後飛回南方，因以「雁」又形容流動無定，如 「雁戶」、「雁民」。
humanum_short_description: 從「隹」，從「人」，「厂」聲，本義為候鳥。

從「 隹 」，從「 人 」，「 厂 」聲，本義為候鳥。候鳥形狀略似鵝，頸和翼較長，足和尾較短，羽毛淡紫褐色。善於游泳和飛行。古文中另有「 鴈 」字，即是「 鵝 」，參見「 鵝 」。「 鴈 」、「 雁 」兩字常互用於古文，學者多以「 雁 」為鴻雁，「 鴈 」為家鵝。《說文》：「鳥也。从隹从人，厂聲。讀若鴈。」《詩‧小雅‧鴻雁》：「鴻雁于飛，肅肅其羽。」毛傳：「大曰鴻，小曰鴈。」 「 雁 」可表示書信。明王錂《春蕪記‧言謝》：「侯門如海思空懸，愁絕魚和雁。」 「 雁 」亦是「 贗 」的古字，表示假的。《韓非子‧說林下》：「齊伐魯，索讒鼎，魯以其鴈往。齊人曰：『鴈也。』魯人曰：『真也。』」陳奇猷集釋引曾廷枚曰：「真贗，本作真鴈，後人加貝。」 雁是候鳥，秋分後飛回南方，因以「 雁 」可指秋季，如「雁天」、「雁宇」、「雁夜」。大雁每年春分後飛往北方，秋分後飛回南方，因以「 雁 」又形容流動無定，如 「雁戶」、「雁民」。
From " 隹", from " people", " factory" sound, the original meaning is migratory bird. Migratory birds resemble goose in shape, with longer necks and wings, shorter feet and tails, and pale purple-brown feathers. Good at swimming and flying. There is another word for " goose" in ancient Chinese, which means " goose", see " goose". The words " Goose" and " Goose" are often used interchangeably in ancient texts. Scholars mostly refer to " Goose" as the swan goose and " Goose" as the home goose. "Said Wen": "Birds. From the fowl to the person, the factory sound. Read like a wild goose." "Poetry‧ Xiaoya‧ Hong Goose": "The swan goose is flying, and its feathers are suppressed." Mao Chuan: "Da Yue Hong, Little said a goose." " Goose" can mean letters. Ming Wangpi's "A Chronicle of Spring Wushang-Xie Xie": "The Hou Men is like a sea of thoughts hanging in the air, worrying about fish and geese." " Goose" is also an ancient word for " pseudo", which means fake. "Han Feizi·Said Linxia": "Qi fought against Lu, slandered Ding, and Lu went with his geese. Qi people said: "Goose." Lu people said: "True also." Really fake, this is a real goose, the descendants of Gabe." Wild geese are migratory birds and fly back to the south after the autumnal equinox. The term " geese" can refer to autumn, such as "Goose Sky", "Goose Universe", and "Goose Night". Wild geese fly to the north every year after the vernal equinox, and fly back to the south after the autumnal equinox. They are also described as "wild goose", such as "goose household" and "goose people."

雁字的基本解释

雁
yàn
鸟类的一属，形状略像鹅，群居水边，飞时排列成行：雁行（h俷g ）。雁序。雁阵（雁行整齐，如同军队布阵）。雁过拔毛（喻为牟利不放过任何机会）。

雁字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yàn］
［《廣韻》五晏切，去諫，疑。］
亦作“鴈1”。
(1)候鸟名。形状略似鹅，颈和翼较长，足和尾较短，羽毛淡紫褐色。善于游泳和飞行。
(2)指鹅。
(3)雁为候鸟，每年春分后飞往北方，秋分后飞回南方，因以形容流动无定。参见“雁户”、“雁民”。
(4)雁是候鸟，秋分后飞回南方，因以指秋季。参见“雁天”、“雁宇”、“雁夜”。
(5)指书信。
(6)“贋”的古字。假；假的。
(7)通“顔”。喻前端。参见“雁行”。

雁字的英文翻译

◎ 雁
wild goose

雁字的康熙字典解释

【戌集中】【隹字部】　雁； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页1364第24
【唐韻】五宴切【集韻】魚㵎切，?音贗。【說文】鳥也。从隹从人厂聲。讀若鴈。【註】徐鉉曰：雁，知時鳥。大夫以爲摯，昏禮用之，故从人。【爾雅·釋鳥】鳧雁醜。【詩·邶風】雝雝鳴雁。餘詳鳥部鴈字註。

雁字的源字形

雁字的起名意思

：天上飞的一种侯鸟，即大雁。与人类的关系也很密切。

Wild goose
Basic explanation of words
Wild goose
yàn
A genus of birds, shaped slightly like geese, living in groups by the water, arranged in rows when flying: geese (h俷g). Geese sequence. Geese formation (geese marching neatly, like an army formation). Goose plucking hair (for profit not letting go of any opportunity).
Wild goose
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［yàn］
["Guangyun" Five Yan cuts, go to admonish, doubt. ]
Also known as "Goose 1".
(1) The name of the migratory bird. The shape is slightly like a goose, with longer neck and wings, shorter feet and tail, and pale purple-brown feathers. Good at swimming and flying.
(2) Refers to goose.
(3) The geese are migratory birds and fly to the north after the spring equinox and fly back to the south after the autumn equinox. It is described as unsteady. See "Goose Household", "Goose Min".
(4) Geese are migratory birds and fly back to the south after the autumnal equinox, because they refer to autumn. See "Goose Sky", "Goose Yu", "Goose Night".
(5) Refers to correspondence.
(6) The ancient word for "pseudo". False; false.
(7) Through "Yan". Yu front end. See "Goose".
Wild goose
English translation of words
◎ Goose
wild goose
Wild goose
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
【Collection】【Department of 隹字】　雁; Kangxi strokes: 12; Page number: Page 1364 Page 24
[Tang Yun] Five Banquet Cut [Ji Yun] Fish 㵎 cut, sound pseudo. [Said the text] The bird is also. Cong Yu Cong people factory sound. Read Ruoyan. [Note] Xu Xuan said: wild goose, knowing bird. The doctor thought it was sincere and used it in a faint manner, so he followed others. 【Erya·Shiniao】The mallard goose is ugly. 【Poetry·Bei Feng】Yong Yongming geese. Yu Xiang's note on the word wild goose of the bird department.
Wild goose
Source glyph
Wild goose
Name meaning
: A migratory bird that flies in the sky, the wild goose. The relationship with humans is also very close.

(недостаток)
Дикий гусь
[Прикреплено] Teng (guang) yon
Частичное
Висящая боль
Дикий гусь
«Гусь» и «гниль» изначально разные: первый - это «гусь», а второй - «гусь», но они часто смешиваются и теперь сливаются в «гусь».
«Чанг» изначально был горной скалой, выражающей звук: один ... Чжу Юань - инородное тело, а позже оно становится «человеком».
Также известное как «магия», это означает «фальшивка, фальшивка».
«Хань Фэйцзы»: «Люди Ци - гуси, а люди Лу - истинные».
